com.undercamber

Interface Requirement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Requirement>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleRequirement

    public interface Requirement
extends java.lang.Comparable<Requirement>
    Interface for a Requirement
    See Also:
    SimpleRequirement

    • Method Detail

      • getRequirementID

        java.lang.String getRequirementID()
        Get the requirement's unique ID.

        Two different instances of this class with the same RequirementID are considered the same requirement.
        Returns:
        The requirement's ID

      • testComplete

        void testComplete(TestData testData)
        Called by Undercamber after the associated test is run.

        The Requirement objects passed to TestManager.initialize(...) during the discovery pass are retained, and the test results from the test pass are passed to them. The Requirement objects passed to TestManager.initialize(...) during the second pass are discarded, and this method is never called on them.
        Parameters:
        testData - The object describing the test status
        See Also:
        TestManager.initialize( SubtestSequencingMode, String, SubtestContinuationMode, Prerequisite[], Tag[], Requirement... )

      • getCompletionState

        TestState getCompletionState()
        Get the test completion status.

        This will typically be the TestCompletionStatus from the TestCompletionData passed into testComplete(com.undercamber.TestData). It can be other values, e.g. when a single requirement is verified by multiple tests.
        Returns:
        The completion status

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Get a description of the requirement.
        Returns:
        String The description

      • getResultsText

        java.lang.String getResultsText()
        Get the text describing the validation results.
        Returns:
        The results text

      • compareTo

        default int compareTo(Requirement that)
        Imposes ordering.

        The default is the lexical ordering based on the output from getRequirementID
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Requirement>
        Returns:
        The integer indicating ordering
